text:
Tomcat does not allow specifying an MBeanServer to register the MBeans with.  If
there are more than one MBeanServers in the JVM, it picks up the first one in
the results.  Because of this, the user has no control on specifying which
MBeanServer to use to register the MBeans.
creator: c1vamsi1c@gmail.com

Can someone from the Tomcat team take a look at this, as we would like to
include an updated level of Tomcat 6.0.x in Geronimo 2.0 when we release it in July?

The patch is a bugfest waiting to happen.  Much simplier is to simply call 
Registry.setServer(MBeanServer) from the Geronimo code before starting 
embedding Tomcat.
